intro: Weihea huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically in Ecuador and Peru. The tree is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
